result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Klint was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua J Klint is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua J Klint was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua J Klint
Current: 325 12th St. SE, Menomonie, WI 54751 United States  (Effective: 08-15-2017)
Prior: Dunn Co. Jail, Menomonie, WI 54751

phone call from Defendant; he will be coming in to make payments arrangements for unpaid fines.  He has files from 2015 and has a 2017 TR case that has recently suspended his license.  Spoke with BV re: the same.

Defendant, Joshua J Klint, in custody, appeared with Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard.  Prosecuting attorney James D Babbitt.  Defendant in custody.  DOC agent Sandra Frigo in court.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(11:45)  MULTIPLE CASES HEARD.
State - argues sentence - deft has done every treatment program available - has substantial jail time credit - agrees with recommendation of dept
14CF47 - 314 days credit
15CF54 - 367 days credit
13CF427 - 168 days credit
15CM441 - was concurrent time
Frigo - has different calculations
14CF47 - 362 days
13CF427 - 168 days
15CF54 - 352 days
15CM441 - 37 days
Rivard agrees except for one matter
14CF47 has 372 days
Rivard argues for time served - the only matter really talking about is 13CF427 other matters time have been served - requests no more then an addtl 30 days on 13CF427, one year on the two felonies and sentence completed on misd. -  allow huber
Deft - addresses the court - believes he's paid about $600 directly to RCU on the restitution

COURT:  14cf47 - 365 days jail - credit 362 days - owe $433.29 made judgment - rest $1152.87 judgment (DOC & deft to check on the actual balance)
15CF54 - 365 days jail - credit 352 days - $318 cc made judg
13CF427 - 320 days - credit 169 days consecutive to the above two - $518 cc made judg
15CM441 - 37 days jail - credit 37 days - $443 cc made judg
HUBER ALLOWED FOR WORK AND TREATMENT
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 22, 2016 at 11:45 am.
DOC requests sentencing after revocation hearing; all files to Br II for scheduling.

Defendant, Joshua J Klint with Attorney Donna Burger appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Janell Evan - Clerk.  1:53 pm
Agreement:  Plead to ct. 2. Dismiss ct. 1
w/held, 1 yr prob, $243 cc and $200 DNA.  No jail.
Def waives rights, pleads no contest to ct. 2, parties stip to facts
COURT:  finds waiver vol, finds suff facts, finds def guilty - Ct. 2
w/held sent, 1 yr probation concurrent with any other probation
Provide DNA sample
11 days credit
$243 cc and $200 DNA chg.  - 60 DTP or pay plan
Dismiss ct. 1

Defendant, Joshua J Klint with Attorney Donna Burger appeared.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Janell Evan - Clerk.  11:37 am

Def waives reading, pleads not guilty, waives speedy trial
COURT:  bond to continue  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
